text: All, would it make sense to revisit the contents of cabinets above the kitchen counter?
For example, I think having the water glasses next to the fridge and the coffee cups above the coffee maker may alleviate some of the “traffic jams” we experience there during peak hours.
+1 <@U06K2R98C> can you add this to the space planning list please?
Sure! All related to the merge kitchen item, so I can include this there

I’m not in that meeting so I’m going to suggest a couple more things here: Look into relocating the coffee maker to a more efficient location than its current one (on the counter or somewhere else), investigate a more efficient process for making coffee (who, when, etc) to prevent jams as much as possible.
What's your feedback on the coffee machine location? Seems pretty ideal w/r/t proximity to water
Blocks folks trying to access the dishwasher, blocks folks trying to make something for lunch on the counter. Currently blocks folks trying to get a water glass.
If there someone making or getting a cup of coffee, that is.
Not ideal if there’s a person using the machine (making/getting a cup) while another person is trying to use the sink.
At noon or other peak hours this is exacerbated by the fact there may be a line of 2 or 3 people waiting to use any of these facilities.
LMK if any of this doesn’t make sense. Happy to chat about it.
i find this discussion pleasing.
I wish I didn’t care about this stuff. I would be a happier man.
can you come over and talk to my wife about where the spices belong?
Ohhhh, you too?
incessantly. i had to create a tupperware shelf in the middle of the spices as a compromise.
Switching mugs location for glasses makes sense to me
The coffee maker should be near water right? Seems like filling it would be super annoying otherwise
Yes. Coffee near water = better than any alternative
I agree.
it may be possible to install a tee at the cold water under the sink and one of those little pex lines to run water elsewhere. probably something we'd have to clear with beam though
I trust those things less than copper pipe though... ask John about his fridge line in Seattle
coffee mugs and water glasses have been swapped

I think that finding a new home for the microwave might solve some of our counter space issues. Perhaps a standing height table that lives against the window / above the garbage bins.  We could even bring in the other microwave.
also, installing an under-counter paper towel holder would ree up some space
how tall for the table. heading to ikea now
not a fan of table blocking window
Wow, that was fast. Thank you <@U0260V1BX>!
not sure if IKEA has a good table for that <@U027PV4AP>
and might warrant more discussion w/r/t john’s concerns
i like the paper towels being mounted to cabinets
micro on fridge too tall?
and our foil container is annoying.
ha yes, never put heated food above your head
well yes that should have a different home
also <@U027PV4AP> i moved the two carafes to the white cabinet with the liquor in it
yes microwave on fridge will not work
for most people :simple_smile:
what are we doing with the second coffee carafe?
ideally it should be in the rotation and should have coffee in it
so, make coffee in it, pour the coffee in your cup
ah! got it. so we can have two empty carafes instead of just one
:stuck_out_tongue:
so we can brew a new pot before the first pot is empty
seems potentially wasteful?
there’s been need for increased coffee capacity. this solves that, no?
if we do need that much coffee can we keep it warm?
We should probably have a sign so folks making coffee know about this.
the carafes are insulated, thats how they’re kept warm
the machine doesnt actually warm it
really?
I bellieve the pad underneath does heat the pot.
according to the instruction manual, that bottom piece is merely a “resting plate"
i may be wrong
it's dripped down on there before and hissed and boiled away
thats true
Same here.
anyway what is the system now? we make coffee if either is empty? both are empty? depends on the time of day?
<@U026E0ZNR> what was your recommendation?
could make a second carafe and bring into client meetings, with the donut spread
I'll chime in that at 9:30 this morning we witnessed the first pot disappear in ~5 mins
and the second pot was already brewing!
yes thank god!

attachments.fallback: [July 10th, 2015 5:16 PM] trent: Actually, brew a new pot when it feels like there is only 1 or 2 cups left in the one to the left.
attachments.text: Actually, brew a new pot when it feels like there is only 1 or 2 cups left in the one to the left.

text: <@U0260V1BX|melissa> pinned a message to this channel.
We did watch the second pot save the day
BTW, if anyone has other potential solutions please let me know

It has the potential to become two empty pots but if we're making the effort it allows us to have more coffee brewing more frequently. If we want the other carafe for another purpose, we should buy a new carafe since this one was designed to fit into this coffee maker.
A note would be nice for other people not in this conversation can know what the deal is.
so it seems like the “resting plate” does not heat the pot. the insulated carafe is what keeps the coffee warm
Looking at other cuisinart machines, they use the term “heating plate"
Melissa is right about the resting plate. I purposefully bought a insulated carafe for client meetings and so we didn't have a glass carafe and so we didn't burn the coffee
the resting plate has a metal plate that has both a resistive heating element and a pipe to circulate boiling water through
you can come see it on the bench
any other requests for instacart? speak now...
trail mix!
traaaiiiill miiiix
<http://giphy.com/gifs/food52-food52-food-52-nw5mWJz4heiKQ>
experimenting- moved microwave and toaster oven to a table by the window. let me know if you love it or hate it.
or have other emotions about it
hate. microwave should be on kitchen circuit and on counter.
why does it need to be on the kitchen circuit?
gfci
fire-starting appliance.
mmm yes
ok well i can move it back
<@U02918BKW> thoughts on swapping it out for the much smaller microwave in the old kitchen?
generally the larger microwaves perform better for physical and wattage reasons.
i am not a frequent user personally, but on behalf of those who are, I would think the higher quality microwave would be preferred.
it does work better :simple_smile:
we bought multiple wattage microwaves for pop secret testing
but god its big
too bad i didn't think to have it mounted into the cabinets.
ha
thanks for restocking our favorite high-calorie uncorked subsidized snack, <@U027PV4AP>!

Oh man, can we order Kool-Aid next time?
